remarks: Lemma for ~ heibor .  We work with a fixed open cover ` U ` throughout.  The set ` K ` is the set of all subsets of ` X ` that admit no finite subcover of ` U ` .  (We wish to prove that ` K ` is empty.)  If a set ` C ` has no finite subcover, then any finite cover of ` C ` must contain a set that also has no finite subcover. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 23-Jan-2014.)
